meanings.definition: To separate or disentangle things that have been mixed together.
meanings.sent1: She carefully unmingled the different colored beads to sort them out.
meanings.sent2: The chef was unmingling the spices to create a new seasoning blend.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved unmingling two scarves to reveal a hidden object.
meanings.sent4: The detective unmingled the clues to solve the mysterious case.
meanings.sent5: The artist unmingled the paint colors to achieve the perfect shade for the painting.

meanings.definition: To undo the mingling or mixing of different elements.
meanings.sent1: The scientist was unmingling the chemicals to study their individual properties.
meanings.sent2: The children were unmingling the tangled yarn to use for their craft project.
meanings.sent3: The robot's main function was to unmingle the wires in electronic devices.
meanings.sent4: The gardener unmingled the plant roots carefully to transplant them into new pots.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic unmingled the nuts and bolts to repair the broken machine.
